Description:

This position is for Pythonists and those ready to switch to Python from another programming language. Yandex.Q is a knowledge-sharing platform: millions of users create communities of interest, ask questions, and receive answers. Header: Backend Developer at Search Answering Service
Description:
Watson, a website data extraction platform, allows you to create a parser for any website in minutes and generate a table with the results of parsing all its pages. Our service is used in over fifty Yandex products.

We are developing two areas of parsing: e-commerce and factual responses. In the e-commerce area, our goal is to organize product information in online stores (parsing catalogs and linking the resulting data with structured data (YML feeds) and stores). The data is used to improve the quality of Search, Advertising, and Market.

To generate factual responses to user queries, we parse existing responses from websites and find the most relevant ones. We combine different approaches to the solution, actively using automatic text processing, crowdsourcing, and machine learning, particularly neural networks. However, we have not yet implemented many good approaches and ideas, and we are looking for people who are ready to do so.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Have a strong knowledge of C++ and Python or have developed in similar languages ‚Äã‚Äãand are able to retrain.
‚Ä¢ Are willing to immerse yourself in new technologies.

‚Ä¢ Configure ML model parameters
‚Ä¢ Implement new code into the Search runtime
‚Ä¢ Build service health monitoring systems

‚Ä¢ ability to understand scientific articles on development and machine learning

Header: Developer for the distributed launch team for autonomous vehicle components
Description: We're constantly improving the autonomous vehicle's performance and driving thousands of kilometers with vehicles running different versions of the code. To increase the scope of code testing, we use data from historical drives. Algorithms process sensor data on a distributed computing cluster (part of the computational pipeline for hundreds of thousands of drive fragments). As a result, we obtain generalized metrics for the algorithms' performance, covering perception, prediction, and planning systems. This helps us predict how changes will impact performance.

If you're interested in ML, willing to conduct experiments, and work with non-standard data, we need you!

‚Ä¢ Implement and test algorithms and approaches to optimize system operation

‚Ä¢ worked with big data
‚Ä¢ know C++ at an expert level

Description:
Yandex.Cloud is a universal cloud platform that helps corporations, medium-sized businesses, and individuals create and efficiently transform their digital services and applications.
No complex system can function without an access control model. One of the primary responsibilities of the IAM team is to provide tools for building such models. The team also handles access management, resource grouping, logical isolation between them, and session and user group coordination.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ have a good knowledge of Java and are willing to learn Go and C++
‚Ä¢ have built and maintained fault-tolerant systems
‚Ä¢ have experience working with relational or non-relational storage
‚Ä¢ pay attention to documentation, code quality, and readability
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Solve algorithmic and optimization problems in high-load services
‚Ä¢ Develop classic enterprise backends in Java with complex business logic
‚Ä¢ Implement industry standards such as OAuth, OIDC, SCIM, and others
‚Ä¢ Monitor service operability during failures
‚Ä¢ Solve product problems and improve current functionality
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ knowledge of TCP/IP protocols
‚Ä¢ familiar with the specifics of low-level network services

Description:
Yandex.Advertising is not only a large and complex service, but also one of the company's key revenue streams.
We are developing a platform for conducting online experiments for Search, Images, Video, Ads, Maps, Zen, and other Yandex services. The platform includes a high-load cloud service for splitting user requests into groups for A/B experiments and a statistics calculation system. This system performs distributed calculations daily on more than a petabyte of source data, calculating hundreds of thousands of metrics for each of the thousands of included experiments. We are also developing tools for analyzing experiment results, which enable Yandex products to develop faster. We use C++, Python, Django, JavaScript, MapReduce, distributed computing, and high-load components.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ worked with C++ or Python
‚Ä¢ know the approaches and principles of creating high-load, scalable systems
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Develop and program new advertising metrics
‚Ä¢ Implement experiments in new advertising products
‚Ä¢ Implement automatic percentage increases in A/B experiments and automatic disabling of poor experiments
‚Ä¢ Develop a comprehensive approach to correctly assessing the results of a large flow of advertising experiments
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ know terver and matstat
‚Ä¢ used ML

Header: Developer and researcher of agent simulation in the self-driving car service
Description:
The key advantage of a self-driving car over a human driver is the ability to endlessly hone its behavior in a virtual world. To create a realistic "Matrix," virtual drivers and pedestrians must be as complex and unpredictable as real people. Therefore, we use neural networks to simulate their behavior (imitation learning). This is still an under-researched area: publications are few, and the task is not clearly defined. Join us if you are not afraid of challenges and are ready to develop in a new field.
You will be part of a small ML team, actively leveraging the experience of your colleagues, and developing a self-driving car. You will reduce an abstract problem to a mathematical one, explore new approaches to simulating pedestrian and vehicle movement, and implement your findings into production.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ have excellent mathematical training
‚Ä¢ have independently developed solutions using ML
‚Ä¢ know how to program in Python
‚Ä¢ can understand scientific articles
‚Ä¢ have experience working with TensorFlow or PyTorch
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ understand new articles and generate ideas. Don't be afraid of challenges; we discuss new ideas within the team, and experienced colleagues from other groups are always ready to discuss your solution.
‚Ä¢ create rapid prototypes‚Äîwe move in short iterations and believe that written code is worth a thousand words.
‚Ä¢ evaluate the quality of your solutions. Evaluating your solution is the sacred duty of an ML developer. This may require you to invent a new metric or refine an old one, or perhaps analyze specific case studies or even drive a self-driving car to evaluate its quality "in action."
‚Ä¢ collaborate with backend developers to implement models in production. A self-driving car in general and a simulator in particular are complex systems. While you will certainly receive assistance implementing a new solution, responsibility for its functionality lies with you as the ideologist.
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ have a good knowledge of C++
‚Ä¢ have experience working with large amounts of data

Header: DL Developer in the Neural Network Personalization Group
Description:
Many Yandex services face the challenge of personalizing or recommending content shown to users. Previously, such tasks were accomplished using collaborative methods and shallow neural networks based on a user's most recent actions.

Recent advances in sequence analysis using deep learning, and particularly transformer models, have opened up a vast array of possibilities for analyzing user behavior at the scale of hundreds of actions. This radical increase in the size of the analyzed context has made it possible to create end-to-end models that take into account user actions across completely different services.

Our team is responsible for the entire development pipeline for such user behavior models, from data preparation to implementation.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ understand the principles of ML
‚Ä¢ confidently program in Python
‚Ä¢ have solved applied problems using DL and one of the standard frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet, etc.)
‚Ä¢ keep up with the latest publications in the field of DL (not just NLP)
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Work with data, extracting interesting signals about user activity from petabytes of logged events
‚Ä¢ Experiment with architecture variations, embeddings, hierarchical transformers, etc.
‚Ä¢ Explore approaches to building models on very long sequences
‚Ä¢ Adapt promising methods described in articles to our data and tasks
‚Ä¢ Optimize model architectures for production release (split-like and offline approaches)
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ processed text and worked with large amounts of data
‚Ä¢ worked on distributed training of neural networks
‚Ä¢ know C++
‚Ä¢ programmed in CUDA
Hashtags: ML DL python tensorflow pytorch mxnet CPP

Description: Yandex.Taxi's backend currently contains several hundred microservices, with new ones being created almost daily. Almost every service has its own storage with real-time access to data; for us, this is primarily PostgreSQL and MongoDB. We provide developers and analysts with a convenient platform that allows data to be deleted from native databases, reliably delivered to long-term "cold" storage, and simultaneously accessed from this storage. All tools allow users to declaratively describe the desired result (whether it's the principle of deletion from a database or the method of delivery to another database), giving users a simple and common solution to specific data problems. If you're adept at understanding large projects, are willing to support them, and are also willing to generate and implement new ideas, we're looking for you.

The rapid growth and development of video formats at Zen presents the backend team with ambitious technical challenges at the intersection of high-load runtime, big data processing, and product development.
We are looking for a developer interested in deep diving into video content processing pipelines‚Äîfrom uploading content to the platform to delivering personalized video recommendations to users within Zen products.

‚Ä¢ know classical algorithms and data structures
Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Develop a more advanced infrastructure for processing and storing millions of video publications, including implementing ML models in production
‚Ä¢ Launch new product functionality in close collaboration with client development
‚Ä¢ Develop an API for Zen users and video creators
‚Ä¢ Expand the capabilities of our microservices development and testing infrastructure

Description:
We are seeking a specialist willing to contribute to the creation of tools and infrastructure for Yandex front-end developers. Our team's goal is to ensure developers can focus on their core business without distractions. For example, we set up continuous integration, develop static code analysis tools, and create new testing tools. Our primary development languages ‚Äã‚Äãare TypeScript/JavaScript (Node.js) and Python (in a 9:1 ratio). We develop some tools (such as hermione) as open source on GitHub. They are also used by teams outside of Yandex. The infrastructure we create for automating code builds, testing, and deployment runs on hundreds of servers under high load. For example, we can run thousands of layout tests in over ten browsers (including mobile) in 5-10 minutes.
We will consider both experienced TypeScript/JavaScript and Python developers and those ready to master and use these languages ‚Äã‚Äãprofessionally.

‚Ä¢ Develop an infrastructure for automated testing

‚Ä¢ Create a toolkit for testing service performance

Header: Backend Developer in the Taxi Pricing Models Group
Description:
Our team works on pricing tasks in the Taxi backend. We're looking for a developer who's ready to join us and help write and support services. You'll need to understand code, delve into the overall logic of Taxi, and think through solutions for implementing new features while taking into account related services like discounts, coupons, claims, increased demand, and many others. And, of course, translating JSON into JSON is essential.
If you're not intimidated by complex tasks and the knowledge that your code will be executed every time someone sees a price in the Taxi app, you'll love it! We develop services in C++ (currently the 2017 standard), and to a lesser extent, Python. We use a microservices architecture based on a framework developed by our colleagues, as well as PostgreSQL and MongoDB databases. We develop on Ubuntu, and our services also run on it.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ have a good knowledge and understanding of C++, STL, as well as classical algorithms and data structures
‚Ä¢ have experience with multithreaded development
‚Ä¢ have developed on Unix or Linux
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Design a service that would calculate prices for over two thousand users every second
‚Ä¢ Create pricing management and control mechanisms using common tools
‚Ä¢ Design a service that would allow for flexible pricing of taxi rides, taking into account a large number of parameters for both passengers and drivers
‚Ä¢ Create software to detect accidental or intentional manipulations aimed at changing the price of a ride
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ have written programs in Python
‚Ä¢ have worked with SQL
‚Ä¢ are familiar with MongoDB
‚Ä¢ have experience working with Boost (Spirit, Fusion)

Header: Sensory data quality analysis algorithm developer for the computer vision team
Description:
A self-driving car makes decisions by analyzing sensor data. However, sensors can be contaminated, faulty, or simply send incorrect data due to damage. You will develop a system for monitoring data from all visual sensors using classical programming, ML, and computer vision.
Since our goal is to drive autonomously safely in all weather conditions and with possible sensor failures, we must ensure that we understand the quality of the data coming from each sensor at all times.
To address this, we are developing a set of algorithms for data quality control and anomaly detection both in real time and across clusters, including using sensor fusion and cross-sensor verification.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ have at least two years of applied development experience in modern C++ and Python
‚Ä¢ know the basic design patterns and can apply them
‚Ä¢ ‚Äã‚Äãhave excellent training in mathematical statistics and theory
‚Ä¢ are interested in ML and computer vision
‚Ä¢ work well in a team and get along well with colleagues
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Develop algorithms for detecting anomalies in sensor data using both classical programming and machine learning
‚Ä¢ Generate hypotheses, test them using data, interpret the results, evaluate them using quality metrics, and implement algorithms based on these hypotheses in production
‚Ä¢ Build data processing and labeling processes on Yandex clusters
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ have a deep understanding of data-driven learning theory: both classical machine learning and deep learning
‚Ä¢ have experience working with visual sensors such as lidars and cameras, and understand the algorithms for combining them
‚Ä¢ ‚Äã‚Äãhave solved industrial problems using machine learning and computer vision: preparing and cleaning data, and collecting data processing processes

Header: Backend Developer in the Taxi Pricing Models Group
Description:
Our team works on pricing tasks in the Taxi backend. We're looking for a developer who's ready to join us and help write and support services. You'll need to understand code, delve into the overall logic of Taxi, and think through solutions for implementing new features while taking into account related services like discounts, coupons, claims, increased demand, and many others. And, of course, translating JSON into JSON is essential.
If you're not intimidated by complex tasks and the knowledge that your code will be executed every time someone sees a price in the Taxi app, you'll love it! We develop services in C++ (currently the 2017 standard), and to a lesser extent, Python. We use a microservices architecture based on a framework developed by our colleagues, as well as PostgreSQL and MongoDB databases. We develop on Ubuntu, and our services also run on it.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ have a good knowledge and understanding of C++, STL, as well as classical algorithms and data structures
‚Ä¢ have experience with multithreaded development
‚Ä¢ have developed on Unix or Linux
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Design a service that would calculate prices for over two thousand users every second
‚Ä¢ Create pricing management and control mechanisms using common tools
‚Ä¢ Design a service that would allow for flexible pricing of taxi rides, taking into account a large number of parameters for both passengers and drivers
‚Ä¢ Create software to detect accidental or intentional manipulations aimed at changing the price of a ride
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ have written programs in Python
‚Ä¢ have worked with SQL
‚Ä¢ are familiar with MongoDB
‚Ä¢ have experience working with Boost (Spirit, Fusion)

Header: DL Developer in the Neural Network Personalization Group
Description:
Many Yandex services face the challenge of personalizing or recommending content shown to users. Previously, such tasks were accomplished using collaborative methods and shallow neural networks based on a user's most recent actions.

Recent advances in sequence analysis using deep learning, and particularly transformer models, have opened up a vast array of possibilities for analyzing user behavior at the scale of hundreds of actions. This radical increase in the size of the analyzed context has made it possible to create end-to-end models that take into account user actions across completely different services.

Our team is responsible for the entire development pipeline for such user behavior models, from data preparation to implementation.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ understand the principles of ML
‚Ä¢ confidently program in Python
‚Ä¢ have solved applied problems using DL and one of the standard frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet, etc.)
‚Ä¢ keep up with the latest publications in the field of DL (not just NLP)
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Work with data, extracting interesting signals about user activity from petabytes of logged events
‚Ä¢ Experiment with architecture variations, embeddings, hierarchical transformers, etc.
‚Ä¢ Explore approaches to building models on very long sequences
‚Ä¢ Adapt promising methods described in articles to our data and tasks
‚Ä¢ Optimize model architectures for production release (split-like and offline approaches)
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ processed text and worked with large amounts of data
‚Ä¢ worked on distributed training of neural networks
‚Ä¢ know C++
‚Ä¢ programmed in CUDA
Hashtags: ML DL python tensorflow pytorch mxnet CPP

Header: Frontend developer for internal services of Verticals
Description:
Yandex.Verticals includes Auto.ru, Real Estate, and Classifieds. Our team develops internal services. We make life easier for our colleagues by creating convenient tools.
We write in JavaScript (with a little TypeScript), using the latest version of React on the client and Node.js on the server. We have a full-fledged backend built on NestJS with an external API, so it would be great if you already have backend development experience. If not, no problem, we'll teach you everything. We write tests using Jest. We work with MongoDB, Redis, and MySQL. On the client side, we have a robust library of ready-made components, so coding from scratch is practically unnecessary. We store our code in a monorepo on GitHub and wrap services in Docker containers. We have an advanced infrastructure for developers: simple deployment, including via a Telegram bot to an internal cloud, and convenient standard interfaces for working with logs and tracing.

Header: DL Developer in the Neural Network Personalization Group
Description:
Many Yandex services face the challenge of personalizing or recommending content shown to users. Previously, such tasks were accomplished using collaborative methods and shallow neural networks based on a user's most recent actions.

Recent advances in sequence analysis using deep learning, and particularly transformer models, have opened up a vast array of possibilities for analyzing user behavior at the scale of hundreds of actions. This radical increase in the size of the analyzed context has made it possible to create end-to-end models that take into account user actions across completely different services.

Our team is responsible for the entire development pipeline for such user behavior models, from data preparation to implementation.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ understand the principles of ML
‚Ä¢ confidently program in Python
‚Ä¢ have solved applied problems using DL and one of the standard frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet, etc.)
‚Ä¢ keep up with the latest publications in the field of DL (not just NLP)
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Work with data, extracting interesting signals about user activity from petabytes of logged events
‚Ä¢ Experiment with architecture variations, embeddings, hierarchical transformers, etc.
‚Ä¢ Explore approaches to building models on very long sequences
‚Ä¢ Adapt promising methods described in articles to our data and tasks
‚Ä¢ Optimize model architectures for production release (split-like and offline approaches)
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ processed text and worked with large amounts of data
‚Ä¢ worked on distributed training of neural networks
‚Ä¢ know C++
‚Ä¢ programmed in CUDA
Hashtags: ML DL python tensorflow pytorch mxnet CPP

Description:
PSP is an internal payment service provider that accepts and processes payments from all of the company's services. Taxi payments, Market purchases, movie viewings on Kinopoisk, and payments from dozens of other services are processed through our system.
Payment flows can exceed a thousand transactions per second, making PSP one of the most heavily loaded services of its kind in the country. Yandex's ability to provide services that make life easier for tens of millions of users directly depends on the service's reliability.
We accept and process both card payments and other payment methods. Our global reach extends across the globe.
Our immediate goal is to provide a reliable service capable of withstanding enormous peak loads, as well as to make the system easily and quickly expandable to accommodate hundreds of new payment methods anywhere in the world. We are writing this version of the system from scratch; we do not yet have a legacy version. Our primary development language is Golang. We're building the system using the Event Sourcing template, using state machines that describe all our business entities. All system entities are described in a single OpenAPI specification, and we utilize code generation and automatic documentation generation. Increased reliability requirements require numerous tasks to ensure a well-functioning and fast geo-distributed cluster.
We use Golang, YT, YDB, PostgreSQL, OpenAPI, and Docker.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ have more than a year of development experience in any popular object-oriented language
‚Ä¢ want to switch to Golang or already have experience developing in it
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Create new services that expand basic functionality: subscriptions, credits
‚Ä¢ Adapt code to constant high and peak ultra-high loads
‚Ä¢ Ensure high system availability in the event of a data center failure
‚Ä¢ Participate in on-call support for system maintenance and complex problem solving
‚Ä¢ Expand the provider's business functionality and implement new payment methods
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ understand Unix principles and have practical experience with such work
‚Ä¢ have experience with relational and NoSQL databases
‚Ä¢ have worked with payment or billing systems
‚Ä¢ have developed systems that comply with SOX or PCI DSS requirements
Hashtags: backend golang YT YDB postgresql openapi docker unix nosql SOX PCIDSS

Header: Developer of universal autoparsers in Search
Description: Autoparser is a universal parser for structured data from the internet. Many industries require structured data, such as data on all products from all online stores: name, image, price, availability, description, etc. Our team makes this process as efficient as possible. We supply data for Yandex services: various components of Search, the Yandex Advertising Network, and Images. Such a large number of data consumers necessitates making the solution more universal and scalable, as well as exploring new ideas and approaches for parsing particularly complex documents. Although we use advanced machine learning algorithms for parsing, our foundation is the infrastructure of the entire service, which allows us to receive data from Yandex Robot in real time and deliver results just as quickly to all corners of Yandex. The emergence of new models motivates the backend team to develop new approaches to document processing, including through significant infrastructure improvements. We are actively expanding as our domains continue to expand, and we are looking for people to help us create the best universal parsing solution.
Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Have experience in commercial development in C++ or Python
‚Ä¢ Know classical algorithms and data structures
Tasks:

‚Ä¢ Develop factors and train models
‚Ä¢ Develop and implement metrics and quality monitoring
‚Ä¢ Suggest ideas for product improvement
Pluses: ‚Ä¢ have experience in ML, especially NLP

Description:
Yandex has a full range of financial systems: its own accounting system, billing and pricing, payment and banking gateways. Together, these systems process all financial flows for Yandex‚Äîfor all organizations in all the countries where we operate.
Currently, launching a new business is a complex process that must be properly distributed across all financial systems. This process involves many people from different departments, knowledge and data are passed from hand to hand, and often gets lost along the way. We want to change this and automate the process‚Äîfrom collecting data for launch to configuring and testing all systems. Header: Head of Data Engineering at DWH in Market
Description:
We are a team of data engineers, and our product is Data WareHouse, which we build for the needs of business units. Our users range from Market executives who need reporting for decision-making to experts in deep data analysis. It's safe to say that all of Market's business units consume the data we supply.

The warehouse's technological core is built on the Yandex Tables (Hadoop, our own development), Greenplum, and ClickHouse data storage systems. ETL processes are developed using a proprietary framework developed internally by Yandex. To organize the data storage model at various levels, we use approaches ranging from Data Lake to Data Vault.

Our data warehouse is currently one of the largest in Russia‚Äîapproximately 10 petabytes‚Äîand given the pace of business growth, it will be the largest yet. It's worth noting that it has high reliability requirements, which presents our team with far from trivial challenges for which there are no ready-made solutions.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ Confident in Python to the level of writing your own framework
‚Ä¢ Confident in SQL to the level of query optimization
‚Ä¢ Developed DWH: layers, data storage models, ETL processes
‚Ä¢ Experiencing management experience as a technical team leader for more than a year
‚Ä¢ Understand the principles of at least one distributed data processing technology: Hadoop, MapReduce, ClickHouse, Greenplum, MPP
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Manage a team of 3-7 developers
‚Ä¢ Responsible for team development and onboarding new employees
‚Ä¢ Conduct interviews and strengthen the team with new developers
‚Ä¢ Form the technical agenda for the development of the core data storage and processing platform
‚Ä¢ Interact with a large number of related teams and users
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ have experience in industrial development in one of the high-level languages: Java or C++
‚Ä¢ know how to work in the command line of Unix-like systems: Linux, macOS

Description: We protect user data in Yandex.Cloud. Data is uploaded and stored in the Cloud using a variety of storage services available on our platform. Uploaded data has different logical structures, undergoes different lifecycles, and is stored on physically remote servers. However, all data requires a unified, transparent, and user-controlled system to protect against unauthorized access. This issue is a priority for large enterprise Yandex.Cloud clients, as well as for users who manage personal data. Ensuring the confidentiality of their data is also important for many other user groups. Our division develops cryptographic services that help users protect their data in the Cloud. We are responsible for the development and operation of Cloud services such as Key Management Service, Lockbox, and Certificate Manager.
Requirements:
‚Ä¢ You know and enjoy programming in Java, and know or want to learn Go.
‚Ä¢ You have experience developing high-load, fault-tolerant backend systems.
‚Ä¢ You are comfortable with the Linux command line.
‚Ä¢ You are familiar with modern data storage systems: relational DBMSs, OLTP, and OLAP paradigms.
‚Ä¢ You are interested in computer security and want to develop in this area.
‚Ä¢ You are independent and responsible, and you are a good team player.
Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Contribute to the development of Yandex.Cloud's Java backend security services
‚Ä¢ Participate in the development of Go-language security libraries and utilities
‚Ä¢ Design and create new user data protection schemes
Pluses:
‚Ä¢ familiar with the specifics of public clouds: AWS, GCP, Azure
‚Ä¢ worked with containerization and container orchestration systems: Docker, K8S
‚Ä¢ familiar with the basic concepts of cryptography and modern encryption algorithms
‚Ä¢ know how Linux works internally
‚Ä¢ are interested in Kotlin

Description:
We are a team of data engineers, and our product is Data WareHouse, which we build for the needs of business units. Our users range from Market executives who need reporting for decision-making to experts in deep data analysis.
The warehouse's technological core is built on the Yandex Tables (Hadoop, our own development), Greenplum, and ClickHouse data storage systems. ETL processes are developed using a proprietary framework developed internally by Yandex. To organize the data storage model at various levels, we use approaches ranging from Data Lake to Data Vault.
Our data warehouse is currently one of the largest in Russia‚Äîapproximately 10 petabytes‚Äîand given the pace of business growth, it will become the largest yet. It has high reliability requirements, which presents our team with far from trivial challenges for which there are no ready-made solutions.
